entry.title: The Dark Knight Before Christmas - A Superbat Year One AU
entry.summary:
Author: EllEmmeCe

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,575Chapters: 25/25Kudos: 43

Summary: Gotham is having a very strange Christmas. Bruce Wayne’s latest vigilante experiment, a horned shadowy figure the press has named “Krampus,” was supposed to terrify criminals. Instead, it has gone viral as Gotham’s new holiday mascot. Clark Kent, investigative reporter and part-time baker, is on the case. He is following Krampus’s trail of cookie crumbs (literally) while secretly moonlighting as “Super Santa” to fix Gotham’s holiday chaos. Between gingerbread turtle clues, a viral photo of Krampus tangled in Christmas lights, and Alfred’s endless commentary, Bruce is one bad cape snag away from losing his mind. Meanwhile, Clark is just trying to figure out if Gotham’s scariest new legend is a monster, a myth, or a very grumpy man who needs a hug. Deffo Crack!fic :P It is a holiday season full of crime, cookies, and questionable branding decisions.

entry.title: There's Something So Lonesome About You
entry.summary:
Author: hoeforhoran28

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 83,081Chapters: 20/21Kudos: 1,400

Summary: "Your identity was supposed to be a secret. Not only to protect yourself (and probably least importantly yourself) but others. Your family, your friends. Everyone who stood a chance at being ripped apart by your decision to go out there everyday and put yourself in the crossfire. Not that Bruce had anyone to protect, besides Alfred. But it was still a fucking given." Or: Bruce has been Batman for two years and if he knew anything, it was that when you don a mask, you don it for a reason. An important reason that just doesn't seem to be as important to the rest of the League as it is to him. This is going to be a story about Bruce being coaxed into allowing others behind his carefully built walls. (Specifically one person.)

entry.title: Sundays, Fridays, and Other Things We Didn’t Name
entry.summary:
Author: NightTwink73

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,611Chapters: 12/13Kudos: 104

Summary: Bruce Wayne’s life begins to reorganize itself around small, unintentional rituals: dinners on Sundays, movies on Fridays, a child who climbs where he shouldn’t and smiles like sunlight.Clark Kent fits into those spaces so easily it’s almost dangerous. entry.title: Superman Works Alone
entry.summary:
Author: Discords_Morgan

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 957Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 21

Summary: Superman works alone. He always has, and he probably always will. It’s not that he’s anti-social — Superman is a friendly face, a helpful presence. He fights out-of-control robots, intergalactic bounty hunters. A toymaker on occasion. Nobody can keep up with him, and that’s probably for the best. He flies too fast, he hits too hard, and most fights are over in a heartbeat. That, and even Superman remains afraid of the day where he’s not quick enough to save someone. To save *the* one.

entry.title: Shake the Disease
entry.summary:
Author: gothamrequiem

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,500Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 31

Summary: Bruce had gotten rid of every other bodyguard Alfred insisted he have. As if he hadn’t already learned to survive on his own. Arguing with Alfred was pointless, of course - he’d remind Bruce politely, persistently, that even a man like him shouldn’t walk unguarded. Bruce had nodded, tolerated it, and then quietly dismantled every option presented. Bruce Wayne doesn’t do vulnerability. He doesn’t do distraction. He certainly doesn’t do temptation - then Clark Kent shows up. Polite, earnest, unnervingly observant. Bruce gives him a week, tops. But there’s a quiet strength behind those Midwestern manners, a presence that keeps pulling at him, despite every instinct screaming to push it away. In a world where emotions are weaknesses and temptation a danger, Bruce has to decide whether he can control what he feels or if he’s already lost.

entry.title: the whole world was here, waiting
entry.summary:
Author: Neery

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,943Chapters: 1/4Kudos: 38

Summary: In another universe, a much darker version of Batman has been holding Superman captive for a year.In this one, Bruce was only planning to neutralize an interdimensional threat. He didn’t plan on a rescue mission. He didn’t plan to take home a hurt, broken captive who may or may not be a version of the Clark Kent he knows. But now that he has, he needs to figure out what to do with him without putting the whole planet at risk.It takes Clark a while to realize he hasn’t just traded one abuser for another, more dangerous one.
